title: Glastonbury: Emily Eavis says she is 'so sorry' after technical issues derail live-stream
description: After thousands are locked out of the virtual concert, organisers make it freely available online.

title: Eurovision: United Kingdom's hopes rest on James Newman
description: Can the Settle-born singer take home the coveted glass microphone trophy from Rotterdam?

title: Diana interview: Lord Hall resigns from National Gallery
description: The ex-BBC director general says continuing as National Gallery chairman would be a "distraction".

title: Noel Clarke: Sky and Vertigo scrap Bulletproof
description: The British actor and director has been accused of sexual harassment and bullying, which he denies.

title: Jeremy Paxman receiving treatment for Parkinson's disease
description: The former Newsnight presenter says his symptoms are mild and that he plans to continue working.

title: Friends reunion to air in UK and Ireland on Sky
description: The long-awaited follow-up to the popular US sitcom will feature all six of its original stars.

title: Behind the scenes of Glastonbury's live-stream concert
description: The five-hour show stars Jorja Smith, Coldplay and Haim - all playing to a deserted Worthy Farm.

title: Lady Gaga had a 'psychotic break' after sexual assault left her pregnant
description: The star says she had a "psychotic break" after being attacked by a male record producer.

title: Little Mix star Jesy Nelson signs solo record deal
description: The singer joins Polydor Records five months after quitting Little Mix, with an album due this year.

title: Eurovision: Iceland through to final despite Covid-enforced absence
description: Daði og Gagnamagnið were unable to perform live at Thursday's semi-final but progressed regardless.

title: Oti Mabuse and Arlene Phillips to stage Cher musical
description: The Strictly dancer and ex-judge will stage the musical, which has already been a hit on Broadway.

title: Banksy: Hula-hooping girl goes on display in Suffolk museum
description: The mural taken from a wall in Nottingham is on show 100 miles away in Suffolk.

title: A Japanese composer, a Burkina Faso story-teller and a Congolese rapper make an opera
description: Japanese composer Keiko Fujiie and Burkina Faso griot Maboudou Sanou helm an ambitious new opera.

title: Can TIX and his Tourette's win Eurovision for Norway?
description: Norway's Eurovision entry has come to this years competition with more than music on the agenda.

title: NFTs: Are they the future of the music industry?
description: Non-fungible tokens have set the music industry abuzz - but are these digital assets set to last?

title: Friends: 7 things the trailer reveals about the reunion
description: Including guest stars, emotional moments, set visits, table reads and Phoebe's singing.

title: Dragons' Den: Why new Dragon Steven Bartlett won’t be wearing a suit
description: Steven Bartlett is joining Dragons' Den but wants to do things his own way.

title: Over 3,000 fans will attend the final of this year's Eurovision Song Contest
description: After being cancelled and replaced by an online 'event' last year, the competition is back on and welcoming over 3,000 fans to the live show.

title: Five decades of Eurovision songs... from memory
description: The BBC's Steve Rosenberg returns to delight you with his piano renditions and encyclopaedic knowledge of the Eurovision Song Contest.

title: The beauty YouTuber who's hosting Eurovision
description: Nikkie de Jager is Eurovision's first transgender host, telling Newsbeat it's "a dream come true".

title: Martin Bashir: Ex-BBC News boss 'didn't know' Bashir forged statements
description: The former director of news did not answer whether Lord Hall, BBC director general at the time, sanctioned re-hiring Martin Bashir.

title: Dave Bautista swaps Guardians of the Galaxy for wrestling zombies
description: Dave Bautista, of Guardians of the Galaxy and WWE fame, leads the charge against a city of zombies in his latest movie

title: The first major Hollywood premiere since Covid
description: Emma Stone takes to the red carpet for Disney's Cruella, after more than a year of Covid restrictions.
